description: This file defines the game model for a Tic-Tac-Toe game, including enums for game modes and statuses, a Marker extension for label representation, and a central GameState class that manages game logic, state, AI moves, and state notifications.

classes.name: GameState
classes.description: Manages the Tic-Tac-Toe game state, handles moves, evaluates win conditions, and includes a simple AI for the computer opponent.

methods.name: setMode
methods.description: Sets the game mode (PvP or PvC) and resets the board.

methods.name: resetScores
methods.description: Resets the scores of both players and resets the board.

methods.name: resetBoard
methods.description: Clears the game board and resets game state, optionally keeping scores.

methods.name: makeMove
methods.description: Attempts to make a move at the specified index for the current player, updates game state accordingly.

methods.name: _evaluateBoardAfterMove
methods.description: Checks for a win or draw state after a move, updates game status and scores.

methods.name: _checkWin
methods.description: Checks the board for a winning line, returns winner and line if found.

methods.name: _computerMove
methods.description: Executes the AI move following a priority strategy (win, block, center, corners, edges).

methods.name: _findWinningMove
methods.description: Finds a move that allows the specified marker to win on this turn.

methods.name: _pickFrom
methods.description: Selects a random available position from a list of preferred indices.
